name: Cyberpunk Neon + Character Highlight Pass
description: Combined grade and subject lift that merges the Cyberpunk Neon (B) and Character Highlight (E) passes for the master frame.

source_frame.notes: Assumes the uploaded master frame with wet asphalt reflections and cockpit subject.
tasks: Expand canvas to 21:9 without cropping primary subject.
Remove the duplicate car on the left edge via inpainting/clean plate.
Recentre the vehicle and pilot to balance the widened frame.

passes.title: Option B — Cyberpunk Neon Pass
goals: Boost neon signage bloom and wet asphalt reflections for a moodier atmosphere.
Shift grade toward magenta/teal while preserving skin-neutral mids.

passes.title: Option E — Character Highlight Pass
goals: Pull focus to the pilot inside the cockpit.
Lift facial exposure and hair glow without flattening the environment.

controls.subject_mask: Feathered mask around pilot and cockpit interior
controls.specular_glow: Targeted lift on interior reflections and visor
controls.color_balance: Preserve natural skin tone; bias highlights slightly warm

checks: No clipping above 95% after neon bloom.
Subject face stays within ±5% of neutral skin reference.
Center of mass of vehicle+pilot aligned within 2% of horizontal midpoint.
deliverables: Side-by-side A/B of base vs. B+E combo
Short note listing tweaks applied and masks used

designer_notes: Apply the neon grade globally first, then layer the character highlight with a tracked mask.
Use a soft light blend for the highlight layer if working in Photoshop; for Resolve/Nuke keep it additive with a limiter.
Lock horizon and vanishing lines when widening to 21:9 to avoid perspective drift.
qa: Verify the duplicate car is fully removed with no ghosting in reflections.
Check that neon sign saturation does not posterize after export.
Ensure the cockpit highlight does not overpower exterior reflections.
